revised_title: The Influence of Pressure on the Spontaneous Ignition of Inflammable Gas-Air Mixtures: Butane-Air Mixtures
tldr: This study investigates the influence of pressure on the spontaneous ignition of butane-air mixtures. The authors found that most of the decrease in ignition temperature occurs when a critical pressure increment is reached, which varies slightly with the composition of the mixture. The results have significant implications for understanding the problem of "knock" in internal combustion engines.
